definition: frost/white powder or cream spread over a surface/frosting/(skin) cream
to freeze/to feel very cold/aspic or jelly

sentences.english: New England had frosts in July.
sentences.chinese: 七月的新英格蘭地區還在霜凍。

sentences.english: The bleak frost packed and paved the square as with some ringing metal.
sentences.chinese: 慘白的霜凍牢固地鋪在廣場上，象是鏗鏘發響的金屬。

sentences.english: Many cold- tolerant plants can be harmed by frost.
sentences.chinese: 許多耐寒植物會受到霜凍的侵害。

sentences.english: We have set up early warning systems for frosts and shelters for animals.
sentences.chinese: 我們已經建立了霜凍預警系統，爲動物建立了庇護所。

sentences.english: The intricate patterns produced by frost, as on a windowpane.
sentences.chinese: 霜花霜凍形成如在玻璃窗上的複雜圖案。

sentences.english: Frosts spoil the last of the flowers.
sentences.chinese: 霜凍凍壞了最後一批花朵。

sentences.english: Hardy annuals are capable of handling frost and some freezing, and still survive.
sentences.chinese: 耐寒植物能夠抵抗霜凍和一定程度的冰凍並存活下來。

sentences.english: Frostburn can also be a problem for some plants.
sentences.chinese: 對有些植物來說，霜凍融化大問題。

sentences.english: September to May the following year as the frost period, frost-free period is short, significant differences between north and south.
sentences.chinese: 九月至次年五月爲霜凍期，無霜期短，南北相差懸殊。

sentences.english: These dunes on a crater floor have a frost of carbon dioxide ice.
sentences.chinese: 隕石坑洞底部的沙丘表面覆蓋着一層二氧化碳霜凍。

sentences.english: When winter comes, we get sleet and frost.
sentences.chinese: 冬天來到時我們這兒會有雨夾雪和霜凍。

sentences.english: A lot of crops were damaged by the frost.
sentences.chinese: 這次霜凍，受害的莊稼不少。

sentences.english: The flowers in the garden died from frost.
sentences.chinese: 花園中的花朵因霜凍而凋謝了。

sentences.english: Many youg plants were killed by the sharp frost.
sentences.chinese: 許多幼小的植物在突然來到的霜凍中死去。

sentences.english: The late rice cannot stand frost .

definition: (bird species of China) grey heron (Ardea cinerea)
to cross (a road, an ocean etc)/to cut across
clear as ice and clean as jade (idiom); spotless/irreproachable/incorruptible
